Text: You can get the lights back up today, right?
Seok-hyeong, I'm holding a cup of coffee.
Sorry.
How long has this place been empty?
Gosh, look at all this dust.
-About three to four years? -Gosh.
I feel like I'm in a club.
That light will burn out soon.
Goodness.
Mom, the power went out again.
Can you get a technician quickly?
I see.
He'll be here shortly, then.
Okay.
Why didn't you also ask her if it's okay for you to drink coffee?
She said one cup a day is okay.
You haven't thrown those out yet.
Why would I throw them out?
By the way, are you really not going to do it?
Gosh, no. Of course not.
Then why are you here?
To see you. I was worried about you.
Then just do it.
You just need Ik-jun.
You don't need me.
He said no.
Seriously? He won't?
I won't do it either.
I don't have time anyway. I need to help my guys with their thesis.
-Help me too. -Why should I?
By the way, did you see Ji-eun today?
Yes.
Did you buy her things that she likes?
I bought her some food
and gave her a Bluetooth speaker so that she can listen to music.
If only you were half as nice as that to your friends.
Did the lights go out again?
Yes. This one was flickering for a bit and burned out.
Gosh, it looks like you probably should redo all the wiring.
We'll get this working temporarily,
-but call a bigger company if it reoccurs. -Okay.
You could've worked on my room tomorrow. You didn't have to work so late.
Thank you.
-All right. -Oh, no.
Be careful, sir.
Sir, you should shut off the breaker before you do that.
You're not even wearing gloves. You'll get an electric shock.
Call an ambulance.
Are you all right? Are you in pain?
Hello? The address here is 33-1 Jogang-dong.
A man collapsed due to an electric shock.
Get here quickly, please. As soon as possible.
Are you having difficulty breathing?
My goodness. What's happening?
Goodness.
Oh, no. What's happening to him?
Here!
We're here!
Here!
Sir.
Sir?
Sir, do you know where you are now?
Just leave him there, please. You did great.
Hey, I'll be back soon.
He had an electric shock seven minutes ago and got a mild burn on his right hand.
I performed CPR for two minutes.
His heart is pumping again, but it's not stable yet.
-Are you a doctor? -Yes.
His vitals seem unstable.
-Could you come with us? -I got an emergency call.
Another doctor will accompany you.
That one.
Are you all right?
You were extremely lucky, man.
Both of them happened to be doctors.
You can hear me, right?
Both his BP and pulse are okay now.
I see.
Why is he shivering like this though?
Hey, are you okay?
He's just cold.
Excuse me. Can you please turn up the heater?
Can you message him or something?
Tell him to jack up the heater.
Seok-hyeong texted you, right? I said I'd do it.
-My answer is no. -So, you got his text?
No, that's what I'll say if he does.
I mean, aren't we too old for that?
I'd much rather go see my girlfriend. Why would I see you guys?
Hey, are you getting engaged today or something?
Why get all dressed up just to see your girlfriend?
I made a reservation at a romantic place in Busan with an ocean view.
Good for you. You're going on a date, while I'm just going to work.
-By the way, how will you get there? -By my girlfriend's car.
There she is. Pull over.
It looks like she's still drunk.
She pulled an all-nighter. And we're leaving right away.
-Hey, you should drive. -All right.
-Hey. -Yes.
Work hard.
You prick.
According to my research,
Daeseong Hospital uses
a non-surgical procedure to treat intussusception.
I've explained to you just now.
As for Bit-na, it's likely that necrosis has already begun.
So surgery is the only option, ma'am.
You're sure, right? Can she actually undergo the surgery?
She definitely needs the surgery, ma'am.
I read on the Internet that it stops kids from growing taller after the surgery.
Don't believe things like that.
Just go to the reception and have them book her surgery.
Okay.
-Then I'll trust you and-- -According to my research,
Daeseong Hospital uses a non-surgical procedure to treat...
Do we have a room for Bit-na? Call the ward again.
Yes, sir.
Please take good care of Bit-na.
-Thank you. -No problem.
Dong-min, can we pull up your top for a moment?
Just once, please.
My gosh, Teddy Bear. You're here because of a stomachache?
Let me have a look.
Yes, doctor. My stomach hurts so much.
Let's see. What?
Wow, this took all the pain away. You're totally fine now, right?
Yes, I'm fine now.
All right, then.
Let's check your mom's stomach now.
Doctor, I already feel much better.
I'm totally fine now.
All right. Then who's next?
-Dong-min, you want to try it? -You want to go next?
Let's see. Good boy. You're such a good boy.
Is this Busan?
I bet I got here before you did.
Let's have dinner together.
Okay. I just need to check on a patient first.
-Doors are closing. -Take it easy.
Who's in charge of Room 513?
Then who worked last night? You?
Who prescribed the fever reducer to Kim Suk-hui in Room 513?
-It must've been you. -No, it wasn't me.
Then was it you?
No, not a chance. I don't even know what she looks like.
Right? You've never even seen her.
You prescribed it without even seeing her because you wanted to sleep.
How dare you prescribe without seeing her?
Are you that confident as a doctor?
If you don't want to be a doctor, just tell me. Don't waste my time.
Do you understand?
-I'm sorry. -I'm sorry.
Hey.
Why all of a sudden?
Okay, I'll be right there.
Come on! Let's go.
Dr. Kim, the patient was hooked up to the ECMO,
but she developed pulmonary edema, so we intubated her.
We looked at the echo but her heart was barely beating.
But Eun-a was okay up until yesterday.
We were going to remove ECMO and move her to the ward.
-Does her family know? -Yes.
Please spare us a moment, ma'am.
Eun-a has developed pulmonary edema as her heart is not functioning well.
ECMO isn't enough anymore.
An artificial heart will be better
in reducing the pressure on her left ventricle.
She needs surgery either today or tomorrow.
My gosh, what should I do?
Doctor, we can't afford to pay for the surgery at the moment.
It'll cost a fortune.
Where can I get the money?
Doctor, please give me a week.
Then I'll figure out a way to get some money no matter what.
Please... My Eun-a...
Please save her.
We can't really wait though. She needs surgery immediately.
If we wait, she may not make it.
What do I do, then?
Don't worry. We have many programs to support our patients,
so I'm sure Eun-a can get the surgery. And we can do it right away.
Hey, look into it.
-Hey, call them now. -Yes, sir.
CARDIOTHORACIC SURGERY CHAT ROOM
5-YEAR-OLD GIRL, DCMP
WHERE SHOULD I CALL?
I have to do the surgery and take care of this?
What do you do?
Hello? This is Kim Jun-wan from Cardiothoracic Surgery.
Can we get some help from the Daddy-Long-Legs Program?
Just a second, please.
SOCIAL SERVICES OFFICE
Hello. I'm Lee Seok-hyeon, a cardiothoracic surgery resident.
Could you help one of our patients with her surgery costs?
We can't wait. She needs surgery immediately.
Yes, can the Daddy-Long-Legs Program help her finance it?
She's five.
It's for implanting a ventricular assist device.
What did you order? Did you order tteokbokki again?
When can we find out?
Go ahead and eat.
Hey, why didn't you order burgers instead?
I got level one, so it won't be spicy. Just eat, will you?
You haven't texted them yet?
We had to do some final checks. We'll text them now.
If everything looks good, you'll get the money in a couple of days.
I see. Please let me know as soon as you hear from them. Thank you.
It's not spicy, right?
You don't find this spicy? You need to see a doctor.
No, that will cost me.
I'll probably get a call soon.
-See? Tteokbokki was a good call. -Just answer that, prick.
Gosh, today's been a disaster.
Hey, I'm still at the hospital.
I'm going to leave now.
Yes, where are you?
Why? I didn't eat anything. Right.
Of course.
-Where are you? -What do you think?
What are you doing this weekend?
I've got a date. Professor Jang is free this weekend.
Everyone's going on a date.
Is Jun-wan still seeing that girl?
This one's lasting for a while.
Why did you call? I bet it's about Seok-hyeong.
I already said no.
No. As for that fool, we can just ignore him.
I have a favor to ask.
-Is everything okay? -Yes, everything's fine.
There's something I've been working on.
You know what? Let's talk in person. You should go home.
I'm going home early for a change.
-What's up? -Min-yeong's vitals aren't looking good.
I have to go.
-What's going on? -Her BP keeps dropping.
It's not getting better even after a full 100ml bag of saline.
-Has she gotten norepinephrine? -Yes, but her vitals are still unstable.
It doesn't sound like you can go home tonight.
YULJE'S CHAIRMAN AHN BYEONG-U UNCONSCIOUS DUE TO BRAIN HEMORRHAGE
CHAIRMAN AHN HAS FALLEN INTO A COMA
WILL HIS THIRD SON TAKE OVER YULJE MEDICAL CENTER?
ALL EYES ARE ON WHO WILL BE THE NEXT LEADER OF YULJE FOUNDATION
Yes, sir.
I read the article.
I have to stay with the chairman all night.
So take care of the craniectomy for the subdural hematoma patient,
as well as the VP shunt surgery tomorrow.
Yes, sir.
But are you all right?
No, everyone's getting ready for the worst-case scenario. It's hard.
-Hello, how are you? -Not well, obviously.
My apologies, ma'am.
No need to apologize. It is what it is.
Don't worry about it.
He's the director of the hospital.
And he is in charge of the Brain Center.
Is that important now?
Right. It's nice to meet you anyway.
Will he not make it?
Frankly, it won't be easy.
But we'll do our very best.
Mr. Pyeon, you're here.
What on earth happened?
Ma'am, please spare me a moment.
Mr. Ju, why don't we have some coffee in my office?
Don't worry about things here.
DIRECTOR JU JEON
-Hey, come and have some coffee. -Oh, I was going to do it.
What's the point of saying that now?
Hey, come join us.
The night view is awesome.
Can you actually enjoy the night view right now?
That punk who's still wet behind the ears is about to inherit the hospital.
He's 40. He's not that young.
Will the hospital
fall into the hands of his youngest son who's a doctor?
I bet he hasn't even written his will yet.
Even if he has one,
the board will have to vote to make the decision.
But they may vote to appoint Mr. Ju to the position.
I think you should call the board members, ma'am.
Even better if Andrea can call them himself.
I'm sure things will go smoothly, but just in case. I mean, you never know.
I suggest you call Chairman Hwang first thing tomorrow.
It's because of Mr. Ju, isn't it?
All the board members are Chairman Ahn's people.
The other members tend to follow Chairman Hwang's lead.
He's Chairman Ahn's friend for 30 years.
Chairman Ahn's wife just needs to make one phone call to him.
Then it's game over.
Chairman Ahn is such a wonderful person.
But he, too, is a greedy man after all.
You can't call him greedy for this.
He's donated most of his assets.
Why did you pick the foundation to begin with?
As for all the other subsidiaries, they hired management specialists.
Jeez, I thought I'd ride on my cousin's coattails for the first time ever.
We don't know yet.
I should do my best.
I called them a while ago. Why aren't they here yet?
I taught my children wrong.
There he is.
Where did Mr. Ju go?
He probably went to his wife's office.
What an eventful year this has been for him.
By the way,
why would Chairman Ahn pass the hospital down to his youngest son?
I heard he has three sons.
Did the elder ones cause trouble or something?
Is next week your last week here?
-Yes. -Back to your hometown?
I suppose you really have no interest in worldly matters.
Even little kids would know the answer to that.
As for his eldest son,
he's too busy with his current job.
Hello.
Hey, you came.
Hi.
Mom, are you all right?
-What about his second son? -He assists someone who's very high up.
Doesn't he also have a daughter?
She's the same.
It's been a while.
Dad...
His second daughter too?
Is my youngest son coming or what?
At this rate, he'll get here after your dad's funeral.
Mom, Andrea is in the elevator now.
Finally. Your brothers and sisters are all here.
My youngest son, please spare me a second.
YULJE MEDICAL CENTER
-You told him, right? -Yes.
It would be a good idea to call him now.
I know it's late, but he'll answer because he's a businessman.
I told him to call him right away.
He's the only one that actually listens to my advice.
He's the most reasonable of them all.
The number you've called is busy. Please leave a message...
He's been on the phone for so long already.
You probably didn't get any sleep. Go get some sleep.
Do you smoke?
Since when?
Jeez, you're a doctor. You shouldn't be smoking. My goodness.
Good.
Mom, he smokes.
I taught him how to smoke 20 years ago.
Did you talk to him?
-Have a good day. -Thanks, you too.
Ground floor.
Such injuries can cause mild bruises and even serious adverse effects.
It tends to happen more often at nighttime.
So if you're a guardian, keep an eye on the patient you're looking after.
If you're a patient on high-risk medication,
or if you need to leave your bed at nighttime,
please make sure you're accompanied by your guardian
or call your nurse for help.
Yulje Medical Center will always do its best
to ensure all patients' fast recovery. Thank you.
PROFESSOR OF NEUROSURGERY CHAE SONG-HWA
All right. Open your mouth like this.
How does this feel?
Both your left and right sides.
-Both feel good. -I see.
I was worried you might experience facial palsy, but it looks good.
You're doing great.
As for your medication, I'll keep you on the same routine.
You can come back in three months.
Thank you for coming all the way here.
Thank you.
Well, I have something for you.
It's just something small.
It's a great book, so I got one for you.
Isn't this book amazing? I have one.
You read it too, right?
Yes, I've read it too.
-My favorite. -I see. You've already read it.
My husband told me to give it to you.
All right, then. I'll see you in three months.
Okay.
-Hello, doctor. -Hello, have a seat here.
Mom, sit here.
We have the results.
A lump was seen on your CT scan, so you got an MRI done.
Unfortunately, it looks like it might be cancerous,
so we'll have to do a biopsy.
You aren't young,
and the location of the tumor isn't ideal,
so it'll be quite difficult to remove it surgically.
You must've been experiencing severe headaches though.
How did you endure the pain?
Can it be treated by surgery, doctor?
No, she needs chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
But before that, we need to do a biopsy to confirm the diagnosis.
I'm suspecting that it's neuroglioma. If I'm right,
and if it's not too bad like grade one or two,
the survival rate will be high. Even just with radiation therapy.
If it's grade three or four,
we'll have to combine chemotherapy with radiation therapy.
But the recurrence rate
and the survival rate will be substantially lower.
My gosh.
What do we do?
Mom.
Mom.
Gosh, my poor mom.
It's okay.
I've lived long enough, so I'm fine.
Gosh, I don't want to hear it.
Oh, Ma'am. It can be treated.
Please don't cry... Oh, my.
First, let's get her admitted so that we can do a biopsy.
I'll explain the plan in more detail when we have the results.
You need to stay strong for your mother.
I'm sorry, doctor.
Thank you.
Thank you.
I feel bad.
By the way, that patient's daughter. Doesn't she look familiar?
I feel like I've seen her somewhere.
KANGWOON MEDICAL CENTER PEDIATRIC ICU
Gosh, another skin tear?
Doctor, that last one took a long time to heal.
My goodness.
Min-yeong, it must be stinging.
-I'll tell him off. -Her skin is delicate,
and she had it on for too long.
My daughter can feel pain too, you know.
Right, I'll be careful from now on.
When will the Professor be here?
What he prescribed yesterday is so different from what she got last month.
She takes Vitamin K and traces elements every Thursday. Why doesn't she anymore?
And as for the blood tests,
you used to draw 30ml. Why do you need 70ml now?
-She's already exhausted. -I explained everything to you before.
-Min-yeong is no longer... -Min-yeong.
Hi, Min-yeong.
Doctor, why did her prescription change?
And last month, she was on the TPN drip for 16 hours last month.
Why is it shorter now?
And don't you think she looks like she's having trouble breathing?
She keeps grimacing too. Something must be bothering her.
Ma'am, Min-yeong doesn't have the strength to hold out for much longer.
I'm sure Dr. Jo already told you,
but we should start mentally preparing--
What's the problem? I did everything you told me to do.
She was doing great yesterday.
Were her vitals good yesterday?
-They were about the same as today. -You doctors rarely see her.
I know much better than you. I'm her mother.
Then I'll have Dr. Jo monitor her all day today.
Call me right away if anything happens.
Yes, sir.
Min-yeong.
Min-yeong.
I'm so sorry.
I'm sorry, Min-yeong.
I'm so sorry that you have to suffer like this.
I'm really sorry, Min-yeong.
My sweet daughter, I'm so sorry.
AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY
Is BP low? How much norepinephrine did you use?
-We're scaling it up. -I'll do it!
My son is waiting for a liver transplant.
I see. That's why you looked familiar.
He was in and out of the hospital all the time for six months.
He practically lived here.
Then three days ago,
his condition suddenly worsened.
My son...
I guess I should give up now.
No, don't say that.
Ma'am, he can get better.
I was so preoccupied with my son and his illness
that I had no idea that my mother was also ill.
It's all my fault.
What kind of mother would think of something else
when her son is critically ill?
No one can blame you, ma'am.
DID YOU MAKE DINNER FOR MY MOM? COME HOME NOW!
Doctor.
I'm pretty sure I'm the unluckiest woman in the whole wide world.
I put up with my in-laws for 40 years,
and my husband
spilled every last penny we had into his darned business.
And my one and only son...
He has a heart of gold, so he's the one that got me through everything.
I must be cursed or something.
I guess that's why both my mom and my son ended up like that.
I'm telling you.
I've been so unlucky in life.
Seriously, I don't even want to live.
Not even one bit.
I just want to end my life.
Doors are opening.
Take the next one.
Okay.
Doors are closing.
I performed your mom's brain surgery.
Shouldn't you be buying me coffee, not the other way around?
When your dad came to the ER at night with a broken leg,
I ran to the ER even though I was off that night. And what? Just iced Americano?
It should be good enough.
If I get you something better, it'll make you uncomfortable.
You have such a way with words.
I guess the ER isn't busy today.
You had time to go to the convenience store.
Watch what you say. You should never say that.
Near Bupyeong IC on the Gyeongin Expressway,
four vehicles, including a one-ton truck, have collided.
In total, six people, including the 52-year-old truck driver,
got critically injured in the accident.
-They're being transferred... -They'll get here soon. I have to go.
Two of them are said to be fatally injured.
The Gyeongin Expressway is partially restricted...
He was found barely conscious.
When we got there, his BP was 60 over 30. And his oxygen saturation was around 70.
He's bled a lot due to a scalp laceration.
Get him ready for an IV and give him normal saline.
What?
Doctor.
Doctor.
My son can finally get the surgery.
Is this a dream? I still can't believe it.
I almost gave up, because he was only third in line.
My gosh, is this really happening?
I heard the patients before him can't get the surgery anymore.
Thank you, God.
That's such amazing news. I'm so happy for you, ma'am.
But I have to say, I feel so bad for the ones who passed away.
I'm not sure if it's okay for me to feel this happy.
I guess we're all selfish after all.
Who's your son's doctor?
He's very famous.
What's that show called? Good Doctors. He was on that show.
-Dr. Kwon Sun-jeong? -Yes, that's right.
He and I are close. He's a great doctor.
Wait. I think he's away today though.
He already heard the news.
He'll come back as soon as he finishes the surgery in Milyang.
He also said he'll operate on my son as soon as he returns.
But... Poor him. He'll be exhausted.
I see.
Is that what's happening?
Doctor, there's another patient over there.
This kid put super glue all over a helmet,
and his dad wore the helmet because he had no idea.
Now, the helmet is stuck on his head. He can't take it off.
He needs to be looked at immediately. Can you take him in first?
But then I'm dealing with an emergency case now. Please wait.
This is an emergency case too!
He's embarrassed to death right now.
Excuse me. Coming through!
Sir, shall we go to a different hospital?
Where are you going, sir? They haven't called your name yet.
U-ju, stop your dad.
Daddy is fuming mad. He said he'll knock them all down.
Professor Kwon, what happened?
I didn't dislocate my shoulder, so don't worry too much.
I can't really move my fingers,
so it's probably a radius fracture.
Get an X-ray done and call Orthopedics.
-What about Neurosurgery? -I'm here.
Hey, you.
This is bad.
Professor Kwon, what about the surgery?
How do you know about it?
You should call another professor at once. The patient needs surgery immediately.
Had there been someone else, I wouldn't have come here after an all-nighter.
There's no one.
Send the patient to another hospital.
If we say we can't do the surgery, they'll just want to take the liver.
This is his last chance.
A long midline incision is required, so it won't be an easy operation.
Gosh, this is nuts.
Let's do this.
How?
We have him.
Me? Hey.
I am double board-certified,
but I haven't dealt with any operations for over five years.
Transplant surgery is no joke.
I'm not talking about you.
Gosh.
Crap.
This is... Oh, right. U-ju, say hello.
They're Daddy's friends. Good boy.
But...
What if the director finds out? Are we going to be okay?
Dr. Chae said she sorted everything out.
But we need to get his mother's consent and explain everything to her.
Dr. Chae knows her well, so she got her to sign it in five minutes.
Still, wouldn't this upset his doctor? I mean, I would be.
Dr. Chae already talked to him and got him on board.
What the heck?
She should get this off my head if she has all that time.
Thank you all in advance.
Let's save this patient.
SURGERY IN PROGRESS
YULJE MEDICAL CENTER
SURGERY STATUS INFORMATION
FAMILY WAITING ROOM
SURGERY STATUS INFORMATION SURGERY IN PROGRESS
Yes. Hello, sir.
Dr. Chae, you're still at the hospital, right?
Yes.
He didn't make it.
Kim Dong-hyeok's surgery didn't go well?
What are you talking about? The chairman passed away.
I see.
His funeral will take place in Room 201. You head over there first.
I came home to get changed. I'll be there shortly.
Yes, sir. Will do.
CHAIRMAN AHN BYEONG-U HAS PASSED AWAY AT THE AGE OF 78.
Hello.
I'm so sorry for your loss, ma'am.
You know that you were his favorite, right?
Yes, of course.
That's why...
I am completely...
heartbroken for him.
I guess we are not too old for tears.
We seem to meet a lot these days.
Aren't you Jeong-won's best friend since little?
I thought you knew his family well.
Yes.
-You knew who he was, right? -Yes.
-Why didn't you tell us? -You didn't ask.
You knew Jeong-won's family was loaded.
I had no idea they were this rich.
Actually, I thought his family went broke these days.
He's been mooching off me for years now.
Seriously. Rich people are stingier.
How could he keep it a secret for 20 years?
So what if we knew? Would we ask for jobs or money?
-That's possible. -That's possible.
That's why that jerk didn't tell us.
Why isn't Ik-jun here?
He's still in surgery. He's probably finishing up now.
It's a difficult one. It'll take him some time.
What do you mean? Why would he do surgery here?
Things just happened that way. We needed him to do surgery.
-He knew about this. -No, he didn't.
Wait. The director is here.
-Hello, sir. -What brings you here?
Say hello. He had been a student of mine long ago.
-I see. Hello. -Hello, ma'am.
Do you know the chairman's son, Professor Ahn?
Yes. He's my closest friend.
-Thanks for coming. -No need to thank us.
We ought to come to our friend's father's funeral.
Is the chairman your father?
Why didn't you tell us? You thought we'd ask for money?
I just couldn't find the right time to tell you guys. I'm sorry.
I didn't try to hide it from you.
I mean, there's nothing to tell you. I don't have any money. I swear.
That's more annoying.
What about the hospital? Will you take charge of the hospital?
The hospital?
I thought I lost my unborn child.
-My heart almost exploded. -We all know you're a doctor.
-Why that ringtone? -Well...
Heart explosion sounds scary. How can you say that so casually?
Do you know how sad it is to lose an unborn child? How can you say that?
You know what?
You don't have any paternal love.
Hey, guys. Stop arguing. My head is about to crack.
Your head is about to crack? Then, you'll die.
Jeong-won.
Uncle is here.
He's here?
Thank you for coming, guys.
Please take care of my brother, Jeong-won.
I called you multiple times. Why didn't you answer?
Sorry. I set my phone to vibrate.
-Dr. Chae, I have the result. -Okay.
Thanks.
Hey, Ik-jun.
All right. I'll be there soon.
-Did the surgery go well? -Yes.
Tell him to come here right away.
I need to do something. I'll be back soon.
-Okay. -Sure.
You were the one who did the surgery.
You should tell her.
Looking like this? Forget it.
If she sees me, she'd lose all of her confidence in me.
Gosh.
I thought about asking the resident to inform his mother.
But I thought hearing it from you would be better. You should go now.
She must've waited for long.
Okay.
Ma'am.
Goodness.
His surgery went really well.
It was a difficult one.
But there's almost no bleeding now,
